title: 'Dislike' button
body: 2 games in a row, with players i wish i never had to see them. Just an idea, you can choose one of 9 other players to dislike after every game, then the matchmaking system will try to avoid putting you 2 in the same game.

replies.body: Or you could just accept that you'll probably never be matched with them again and if you are it's probably because you jumped straight back into queue.
I have played with a few of them for more than 2 times on different days, and I'm pretty sure there are more I just don't remember their names.

I'm not saying it doesn't happen. I've had the rare occurrence of being matched with someone who I'd been matches with a few days prior (and they always play differently) but it's certainly not common enough for an entirely new system to be implemented to affect how the matchmaking works to avoid matching you with specific individuals. If you truly want to avoid being matched with someone again you could try reporting the for "unskilled player" (this actually forces the system to check it's matching them with the right people) and hope that it wasn't just that they were having a bad game. Chances are that, by the time you do come across these people again (if ever), you'll have completely forgotten about them.
Also, report for unskilled player only affects non ranked play.
Like I said, I only encounter a few of them, roughly 3 to 5 for more than 2 times. I can only estimate the chances, as I only played 100 ish ranked games this season.
so what happens when you eventually 'dislike' all other players in your elo when you lose roughly 50% of the time.. you just never get into a match?

As far as I can see, there are 3 player (maxed) that are trolling, which means at least 60% of my elo are decent players (assuming Im not). If you think everyone in your elo are trolls or feeders, I don't see how that is my problem.

>
> As far as I can see, there are 3 player (maxed) that are trolling, which means at least 60% of my elo are decent players (assuming Im not). If you think everyone in your elo are trolls or feeders, I don't see how that is my problem.

define trolling. usually anyone that does bad is considered a troll/feeder and you should report them. this is especially the case in low elo. "report unskilled". so seeing its low elo, you can assume everyone falls into this category of being bad. everyone loses games roughly 50% of the time in the long term, therefore you can assume everybody will be blamed at some point by other people and be SNAP 'disliked'. this is a relatively small server in terms of population, so the system will eventually find it difficult to match 10 people together that all 'like' each other.

I'm sorry I didn't make it clear, it's more like you do not team up with them. I said max, meaning you must have done some real shit to deserve 3 trolls in one game, and that includes people in enemy team as well. People that afk , intentionally feed , or not willing to cooperate, are trolls. I'm fine with player that does not perform well in a game, as long as they are willing to take advise from others.

What happens when people start disliking everyone they percieve as "bad", or everyone else who plays the same role as them so they get what they want more often. Either the queue times become insane or the system is forced to ignore all the dislikes and match people together anyway making the system useless.
